content:
@Grahame Grieve , I'm facing the following error from IG build (latest). when I checked with Shrimp, I can find them however IG publisher doesn't. Please suggest if any action is required from my side to get them resolve
unable to find code 5703600 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#5703600'
unable to find code 1368901000168106 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#1368901000168106'
unable to find code 1368911000168109 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#1368911000168109'
unable to find code 1222461000168103 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#1222461000168103'
unable to find code 1347121000168105 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#1347121000168105'
unable to find code 1368921000168102 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#1368921000168102'
unable to find code 69775011000036100 in http://snomed.info/sct (version http://snomed.info/sct/900000000000207008/version/20190731) for 'http://snomed.info/sct#69775011000036100'
i don't see 1347121000168105 , for example in the international release
thanks @Grahame Grieve , these are from AU release I found. did you have a chance to check 5703600?
@Grahame Grieve I've found out a typo on the snomed code the right code is 57036006. please ignore this one.
if they're in the AU release, then you should tell the IG publisher to use the AU release. 900000000000207008 is the intl release
thanks @Grahame Grieve I've used "sct-edition": "http://snomed.info/sct/32506021000036107", in the ig.json but still getting these errors. Do I have to mention this SNOMED module anywhere else?
no. it was a bug on tx.fhir.org. Delete your txCache and try again
thanks @Grahame Grieve .. I tried removing the txCache in my local, it didn't help. The same is happening with CI build http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7au/au-fhir-childhealth/branches/master/qa.html

@Grahame Grieve a quick update.. after doing a full clean-up and taking the latest jar I was able to point to SNOMED CT AU. However, It seems it is working only if I provide a version number. with this url, I can see new error messages: Unable to provide support for code system http://snomed.info/sct version http://snomed.info/sct/32506021000036107/version/20191231. How would I know what SNOMED CT AU version is supported?
it appears that it's running 20161031. I think it's really time we upgraded. @Rob Hausam can you do that?

Yes, I actually started working on that yesterday (prior to seeing this). I've been temporarily blocked, though, by an error that I ran into near the end of the import process. Further details here. Once we get through that error it will be up to date.
thanks @Grahame Grieve , @Rob Hausam . looking forward to it. Once this is done, I believe my IG will be in a much better shape for the Sydney Connect-a-thon :)
ok upgraded (@Rob Hausam I finished the import while debugging so I just upgraded it)
OK, makes sense. Shovan will be happy. :) The US and Canadian editions and LOINC are all a version behind, so I will update those.
A quick summary of what the problem was with importing the refsets (or other issues)?
I'm not sure, actually. I took the debugging statment out and had some other thing which just suddnely went away
wonderful.. @Grahame Grieve and @Rob Hausam .. let me quickly test it and confirm.. thanks for looking into this :)
Ah, ok. Sometimes it goes that way.
At least I have an account and can download SNOMED CT-AU now, so will be easier to keep it updated in the future.
I can confirm this worked..my IG looks much cleaner now :)
